info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 6:10PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR INCREASINGLY HAZARDOUS DRIVING CONDITIONS DUE TO SNOW-COVERED ROADWAYS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES THROUGH LATE THIS EVENING NORTH OF THE I-69 CORRIDOR...... WEATHER... * Moderate snow will continue to increase in intensity and impact portions of Southeast Michigan north of the I-69 corridor through 9 PM. Pockets of heavy snow will also be possible at times. * Snow accumulations of up to 3 inches will be possible. * Hourly snowfall rates up to 1 inch per hour will be possible. * Northeast wind gusts up to 35 to 45 mph will be possible resulting in near whiteout conditions at times. * Air temperatures will hover near freezing. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow may lead to slippery roadways, particularly on bridges, exit ramps, and overpasses. * Snowfall will cause reductions of visibility to less than one mile. There may be rapid fluctuations of visibility. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Moderate snow and temperatures near freezing will result in localized slippery conditions and variable traffic rates. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
